object_id.description: The GUID of the object in the index service.

workflow_link.description: Link to Github hash for the CWL workflow used.

workflow_version.description: Major version for a GDC workflow.

submitter_id.description: A project-specific identifier for a node. This property is the calling card/nickname/alias for a unit of submission. It can be used in place of the UUID for identifying or recalling a node.

data_category.description: Broad categorization of the contents of the data file.

data_file_error_type.description: Type of error for the data file object.

data_type.description: Specific content type of the data file. (CMG)

datetime.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]

encoding.description: Version of ASCII encoding of quality values found in the file.

file_format.description: The format of the data file object.

file_name.description: The name (or part of a name) of a file (of any type).

file_size.description: The size of the data file (object) in bytes.

file_state.description: The current state of the data file object.

md5sum.description: The 128-bit hash value expressed as a 32 digit hexadecimal number used as a file's digital fingerprint.

project_id.description: Unique ID for any specific defined piece of work that is undertaken or attempted to meet a single requirement.

state.description: The current state of the object.

UUID.description: A 128-bit identifier. Depending on the mechanism used to generate it, it is either guaranteed to be different from all other UUIDs/GUIDs generated until 3400 AD or extremely likely to be different. Its relatively small size lends itself well to sorting, ordering, and hashing of all sorts, storing in databases, simple allocation, and ease of programming in general.

microsatellite_instability_abnormal.description: The yes/no indicator to signify the status of a tumor for microsatellite instability.

morphology.description: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000 used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms. The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs. In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains. A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

termDef.term: International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, Third Edition ICD-O-3 Histology Code

new_event_anatomic_site.description: Text term to specify the anatomic location of the return of tumor after treatment.

termDef.term: New Neoplasm Event Occurrence Anatomic Site

new_event_type.description: Text term to identify a new tumor event.

normal_tumor_genotype_snp_match.description: Text term that represents whether or not the genotype of the normal tumor matches or if the data is not available.

number_proliferating_cells.description: Numeric value that represents the count of proliferating cells determined during pathologic review of the sample slide(s).

termDef.term: Pathology Review Slide Proliferating Cell Count

oct_embedded.description: Indicator of whether or not the sample was embedded in Optimal Cutting Temperature (OCT) compound.

termDef.term: Tissue Sample Optimal Cutting Temperature Compound Embedding Indicator

years_smoked.description: Numeric value (or unknown) to represent the number of years a person has been smoking (HARMONIZED). If the number of years is greater than 89, see 'years_smoked_gt89'.

percent_eosinophil_infiltration.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of infiltration by eosinophils in a tumor sample or specimen.

percent_gc_content.description: The overall %GC of all bases in all sequences.

percent_granulocyte_infiltration.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of infiltration by granulocytes in a tumor sample or specimen.

percent_inflam_infiltration.description: Numeric value to represent local response to cellular injury, marked by capillary dilatation, edema and leukocyte infiltration; clinically, inflammation is manifest by reddness, heat, pain, swelling and loss of function, with the need to heal damaged tissue.

percent_lymphocyte_infiltration.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of infiltration by lymphocytes in a solid tissue normal sample or specimen.

percent_monocyte_infiltration.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of monocyte infiltration in a sample or specimen.

percent_necrosis.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of cell death in a malignant tumor sample or specimen.

percent_neutrophil_infiltration.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of infiltration by neutrophils in a tumor sample or specimen.

termDef.term: Malignant Neoplasm Neutrophil Infiltration Percentage Cell Value

percent_normal_cells.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of normal cell content in a malignant tumor sample or specimen.

termDef.term: Malignant Neoplasm Normal Cell Percentage Value

percent_stromal_cells.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of reactive cells that are present in a malignant tumor sample or specimen but are not malignant such as fibroblasts, vascular structures, etc.

termDef.term: Malignant Neoplasm Stromal Cell Percentage Value

percent_tumor_cells.description: Numeric value that represents the percentage of infiltration by granulocytes in a sample.

percent_tumor_nuclei.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of tumor nuclei in a malignant neoplasm sample or specimen.

termDef.term: Malignant Neoplasm Neoplasm Nucleus Percentage Cell Value

perineural_invasion_present.description: a yes/no indicator to ask if perineural invasion or infiltration of tumor or cancer is present.

platform.description: Name of the platform used to obtain data.

portion_number.description: Numeric value that represents the sequential number assigned to a portion of the sample.

portion_weight.description: Numeric value that represents the sample portion weight, measured in milligrams.

preservation_method.description: Text term that represents the method used to preserve the sample.

prior_malignancy.description: Text term to describe the patient's history of prior cancer diagnosis and the spatial location of any previous cancer occurrence.

termDef.term: Prior Cancer Diagnosis Occurrence Description Text

prior_treatment.description: A yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to the administration of therapeutic agents received before the body specimen was collected.

termDef.term: Therapeutic Procedure Prior Specimen Collection Administered Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator

progesterone_receptor_percent_positive_i.description: Classification to represent Progesterone Receptor Positive results expressed as a percentage value.

termDef.term: Progesterone Receptor Level Cell Percentage Category

progesterone_receptor_result_ihc.description: Text term to represent the overall result of Progresterone Receptor (PR) testing.

progression_or_recurrence.description: Yes/No/Unknown indicator to identify whether a patient has had a new tumor event after initial treatment.

termDef.term: New Neoplasm Event Post Initial Therapy Indicator

qc_metric_state.description: State classification given by FASTQC for the metric. Metric specific details about the states are available on their website.

race.description: An arbitrary classification of a taxonomic group that is a division of a species (HARMONIZED). It usually arises as a consequence of geographical isolation within a species and is characterized by shared heredity, physical attributes and behavior, and in the case of humans, by common history, nationality, or geographic distribution. The provided values are based on the categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau. (GTEx)

read_group_name.description: The name of the read group.

relationship_age_at_diagnosis.description: The age (in years) when the patient's relative was first diagnosed.

relationship_to_proband.description: The subgroup that describes the state of connectedness between members of the unit of society organized around kinship ties.

relationship_type.description: The subgroup that describes the state of connectedness between members of the unit of society organized around kinship ties.

relative_with_cancer_history.description: Indicator to signify whether or not an individual's biological relative has been diagnosed with another type of cancer.

termDef.term: Other Cancer Biological Relative History Indicator

residual_disease.description: Text terms to describe the status of a tissue margin following surgical resection.

RIN.description: A numerical assessment of the integrity of RNA based on the entire electrophoretic trace of the RNA sample including the presence or absence of degradation products.

sample_type.description: Text term to describe the source of a biospecimen used for a laboratory test.

sample_type_id.description: The accompanying sample type id for the sample type.

sequencing_center.description: Name of the center that provided the sequence files.

shortest_dimension.description: Numeric value that represents the shortest dimension of the sample, measured in millimeters.

termDef.term: Tissue Sample Short Dimension Millimeter Measurement

site_of_resection_or_biopsy.description: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000, used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms. The description of an anatomical region or of a body part. Named locations of, or within, the body. A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

termDef.term: International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, Third Edition ICD-O-3 Site Code

smoking_history.description: Category describing current smoking status and smoking history as self-reported by a patient.

smoking_intensity.description: Numeric computed value to represent lifetime tobacco exposure defined as number of cigarettes smoked per day x number of years smoked divided by 20

termDef.term: Person Cigarette Smoking History Pack Year Value

source_center.description: Name of the center that provided the item.

spectrophotometer_method.description: Name of the method used to determine the concentration of purified nucleic acid within a solution.

termDef.term: Purification Nucleic Acid Solution Concentration Determination Method Type

spike_ins_fasta.description: Name of the FASTA file that contains the spike-in sequences.

therapeutic_agents.description: Text identification of the individual agent(s) used as part of a prior treatment regimen.

time_between_clamping_and_freezing.description: Numeric representation of the elapsed time between the surgical clamping of blood supply and freezing of the sample, measured in minutes.

termDef.term: Tissue Sample Clamping and Freezing Elapsed Minute Time

time_between_excision_and_freezing.description: Numeric representation of the elapsed time between the excision and freezing of the sample, measured in minutes.

termDef.term: Tissue Sample Excision and Freezing Elapsed Minute Time

tissue_or_organ_of_origin.description: Text term that describes the anatomic site of the tumor or disease.

tissue_type.description: Text term that represents a description of the kind of tissue collected with respect to disease status or proximity to tumor tissue.

to_trim_adapter_sequence.description: Does the user suggest adapter trimming?

tobacco_smoking_onset_year.description: The year in which the participant began smoking.

tobacco_smoking_quit_year.description: The year in which the participant quit smoking.

tobacco_smoking_status.description: Category describing current smoking status and smoking history as self-reported by a patient.

total_sequences.description: A count of the total number of sequences processed.

treatment_anatomic_site.description: The anatomic site or field targeted by a treatment regimen or single agent therapy.

treatment_intent_type.description: Text term to identify the reason for the administration of a treatment regimen. [Manually-curated]

treatment_or_therapy.description: A yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to the administration of therapeutic agents received before the body specimen was collected.

termDef.term: Therapeutic Procedure Prior Specimen Collection Administered Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator

treatment_outcome.description: Text term that describes the patientÂ¿s final outcome after the treatment was administered.

treatment_type.description: Text term that describes the kind of treatment administered.

tumor_grade.description: Numeric value to express the degree of abnormality of cancer cells, a measure of differentiation and aggressiveness.

tumor_code.description: Diagnostic tumor code of the tissue sample source.

tumor_code_id.description: BCR-defined id code for the tumor sample.

tumor_descriptor.description: Text that describes the kind of disease present in the tumor specimen as related to a specific timepoint.

tumor_stage.description: The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body. The accepted values for tumor_stage depend on the tumor site, type, and accepted staging system. These items should accompany the tumor_stage value as associated metadata.

vascular_invasion_present.description: The yes/no indicator to ask if large vessel or venous invasion was detected by surgery or presence in a tumor specimen.

vital_status.description: The survival state of the person registered on the protocol.

weight.description: The weight of the patient measured in lbs (HARMONIZED).

well_number.description: Numeric value that represents the the well location within a plate for the analyte or aliquot from the sample.

termDef.term: Biospecimen Analyte or Aliquot Plate Well Number

workflow_type.description: Generic name for the workflow used to analyze a data set.

year_of_birth.description: Numeric value to represent the calendar year in which an individual was born.

year_of_diagnosis.description: Numeric value to represent the year of an individual's initial pathologic diagnosis of cancer.

year_of_death.description: Numeric value to represent the year of the death of an individual.

years_smoked_gt89.description: Indicate whether the numeric value to represent the number of years a person has been smoking (HARMONIZED) is greater than 89 years.

ga4gh_drs_uri.description: DRS URI as defined by GA4GH DRS spec for pointers to file objects.

research_study.title: ResearchStudy
research_study.description:
Investigation to increase healthcare-related patient-independent knowledge.
A process where a researcher or organization plans and then executes a
series of steps intended to increase the field of healthcare-related
knowledge.  This includes studies of safety, efficacy, comparative
effectiveness and other information about medications, devices, therapies
and other interventional and investigative techniques.  A ResearchStudy
involves the gathering of information about human or animal subjects.

arm.title: Defined path through the study for a subject
arm.description: Describes an expected sequence of events for one of the participants of a study.  E.g. Exposure to drug A, wash-out, exposure to drug B, wash-out, follow-up. (array: ResearchStudyArm.yaml

category.title: Classifications for the study
category.description: Codes categorizing the type of study such as investigational vs. observational, type of blinding, type of randomization, safety vs. efficacy, etc. (array: CodeableConcept.yaml
category.binding_description: Codes that describe the type of research study.  E.g. Study phase, Interventional/Observational, blinding type, etc.

condition.title: Condition being studied
condition.description: The condition that is the focus of the study.  For example, In a study to examine risk factors for Lupus, might have as an inclusion criterion "healthy volunteer", but the target condition code would be a Lupus SNOMED code. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/condition-code (array: CodeableConcept.yaml
condition.binding_description: Identification of the condition or diagnosis.

term.description: Identification of the condition or diagnosis.

contact.title: Contact details for the study
contact.description: Contact details to assist a user in learning more about or engaging with the study. (array: ContactDetail.yaml

description.title: What this is study doing
description.description: A full description of how the study is being conducted.

enrollment.title: Inclusion & exclusion criteria
enrollment.description: Reference to a Group that defines the criteria for and quantity of subjects participating in the study.  E.g. " 200 female Europeans between the ages of 20 and 45 with early onset diabetes". Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. (array: Reference.yaml

extension.title: Additional content defined by implementations
extension.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. (array: Extension.yaml

focus.title: Drugs, devices, etc. under study
focus.description: The medication(s), food(s), therapy(ies), device(s) or other concerns or interventions that the study is seeking to gain more information about. (array: CodeableConcept.yaml
focus.binding_description: Codes for medications, devices and other interventions.

id.title: Logical id of this artifact
id.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

identifier.title: Business Identifier for study
identifier.description: Identifiers assigned to this research study by the sponsor or other systems. (array: Identifier.yaml

keyword.title: Used to search for the study
keyword.description: Key terms to aid in searching for or filtering the study. (array: CodeableConcept.yaml
keyword.binding_description: Words associated with the study that may be useful in discovery.

location.title: Geographic region(s) for study
location.description: Indicates a country, state or other region where the study is taking place. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/jurisdiction (array: CodeableConcept.yaml
location.binding_description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

term.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

note.title: Comments made about the study
note.description: Comments made about the study by the performer, subject or other participants. (array: Annotation.yaml

objective.title: A goal for the study
objective.description: A goal that the study is aiming to achieve in terms of a scientific question to be answered by the analysis of data collected during the study. (array: ResearchStudyObjective.yaml

partOf.title: Part of larger study
partOf.description: A larger research study of which this particular study is a component or step. (array: Reference.yaml

phase.title: n-a | early-phase-1 | phase-1 | phase-1-phase-2 | phase-2 | phase-2-phase-3 | phase-3 | phase-4
phase.description: The stage in the progression of a therapy from initial experimental use in humans in clinical trials to post-market evaluation. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/research-study-phase CodeableConcept
phase.binding_description: Codes for the stage in the progression of a therapy from initial experimental use in humans in clinical trials to post-market evaluation.

term.description: Codes for the stage in the progression of a therapy from initial experimental use in humans in clinical trials to post-market evaluation.

primaryPurposeType.title: treatment | prevention | diagnostic | supportive-care | screening | health-services-research | basic-science | device-feasibility
primaryPurposeType.description: The type of study based upon the intent of the study's activities. A classification of the intent of the study. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/research-study-prim-purp-type CodeableConcept
primaryPurposeType.binding_description: Codes for the main intent of the study.

term.description: Codes for the main intent of the study.

protocol.title: Steps followed in executing study
protocol.description: The set of steps expected to be performed as part of the execution of the study. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. PlanDefinition (array: Reference.yaml

reasonStopped.title: accrual-goal-met | closed-due-to-toxicity | closed-due-to-lack-of-study-progress | temporarily-closed-per-study-design
reasonStopped.description: A description and/or code explaining the premature termination of the study. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/research-study-reason-stopped CodeableConcept
reasonStopped.binding_description: Codes for why the study ended prematurely.

term.description: Codes for why the study ended prematurely.

relatedArtifact.title: References and dependencies
relatedArtifact.description: Citations, references and other related documents. (array: RelatedArtifact.yaml

site.title: Facility where study activities are conducted
site.description: A facility in which study activities are conducted. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. Location (array: Reference.yaml

status.title: active | administratively-completed | approved | closed-to-accrual | closed-to-accrual-and-intervention | completed | disapproved | in-review | temporarily-closed-to-accrual | temporarily-closed-to-accrual-and-intervention | withdrawn
status.description: The current state of the study. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/research-study-status
status.binding_description: Codes that convey the current status of the research study.

term.description: Codes that convey the current status of the research study.

title.title: Name for this study
title.description: A short, descriptive user-friendly label for the study.

patient.title: Patient
patient.description:
Information about an individual or animal receiving health care services.
Demographics and other administrative information about an individual or
animal receiving care or other health-related services.

active.title: Whether this patient's record is in active use
active.description: Whether this patient record is in active use.  Many systems use this property to mark as non-current patients, such as those that have not been seen for a period of time based on an organization's business rules.  It is often used to filter patient lists to exclude inactive patients  Deceased patients may also be marked as inactive for the same reasons, but may be active for some time after death.

birthDate.title: The date of birth for the individual

communication.title: A language which may be used to communicate with the patient about his or her health

contact.title: A contact party (e.g. guardian, partner, friend) for the patient

deceasedBoolean.title: Indicates if the individual is deceased or not

deceasedDateTime.title: Indicates if the individual is deceased or not

disability_adjusted_life_years_valueDeci.description: Disability Adjusted Life Years as defined in the literature and summarized at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disability-adjusted_life_year http://synthetichealth.github.io/synthea/StructureDefinition/disability-adjusted-life-years

extension.title: Additional content defined by implementations
extension.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. (array: Extension.yaml

gender.title: male | female | other | unknown
gender.description: Administrative Gender - the gender that the patient is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/administrative-gender
gender.binding_description: The gender of a person used for administrative purposes.

term.description: The gender of a person used for administrative purposes.

generalPractitioner.title: Patient's nominated primary care provider
generalPractitioner.description: Patient's nominated care provider. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. Organization Practitioner PractitionerRole (array: Reference.yaml

id.title: Logical id of this artifact
id.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

link.title: Link to another patient resource that concerns the same actual person
link.description: Link to another patient resource that concerns the same actual patient. (array: PatientLink.yaml

maritalStatus.title: Marital (civil) status of a patient
maritalStatus.description: This field contains a patient's most recent marital (civil) status. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/marital-status CodeableConcept
maritalStatus.binding_description: The domestic partnership status of a person.

term.description: The domestic partnership status of a person.

maritalStatus_coding.description: This field contains a patient's most recent marital (civil) status. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/marital-status

multipleBirthBoolean.title: Whether patient is part of a multiple birth
multipleBirthBoolean.description: Indicates whether the patient is part of a multiple (boolean) or indicates the actual birth order (integer).

multipleBirthInteger.title: Whether patient is part of a multiple birth
multipleBirthInteger.description: Indicates whether the patient is part of a multiple (boolean) or indicates the actual birth order (integer).

name.title: A name associated with the patient
name.description: A name associated with the individual. (array: HumanName.yaml

patient_birthPlace_valueAddress.description: The registered place of birth of the patient. A sytem may use the address.text if they don't store the birthPlace address in discrete elements.

patient_mothersMaidenName.description: Mother's maiden (unmarried) name, commonly collected to help verify patient identity.

quality_adjusted_life_years_valueDecimal.description: Quality Adjusted Life Years as defined in the literature and summarized at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quality-adjusted_life_year   http://synthetichealth.github.io/synthea/StructureDefinition/quality-adjusted-life-years.

telecom.title: A contact detail for the individual
telecom.description: A contact detail (e.g. a telephone number or an email address) by which the individual may be contacted. (array: ContactPoint.yaml

us_core_birthsex_code.description: A code classifying the personâs sex assigned at birth as specified by the Office of the National Coordinator for Health IT (ONC). This extension aligns with the C-CDA Birth Sex Observation (LOINC 76689-9).

us_core_ethnicity_coding.description: The 2 ethnicity category codes according to the [OMB Standards for Maintaining, Collecting, and Presenting Federal Data on Race and Ethnicity, Statistical Policy Directive No. 15, as revised, October 30, 1997](https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/FR-1997-10-30/pdf/97-28653.pdf).

us_core_race_coding.description: The 5 race category codes according to the [OMB Standards for Maintaining, Collecting, and Presenting Federal Data on Race and Ethnicity, Statistical Policy Directive No. 15, as revised, October 30, 1997](https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/FR-1997-10-30/pdf/97-28653.pdf).

research_subject.title: ResearchSubject
research_subject.description:
Physical entity which is the primary unit of interest in the study.
A physical entity which is the primary unit of operational and/or
administrative interest in a study.

actualArm.title: What path was followed
actualArm.description: The name of the arm in the study the subject actually followed as part of this study.

assignedArm.title: What path should be followed
assignedArm.description: The name of the arm in the study the subject is expected to follow as part of this study.

extension.title: Additional content defined by implementations
extension.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. (array: Extension.yaml

id.title: Logical id of this artifact
id.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

identifier.title: Business Identifier for research subject in a study
identifier.description: Identifiers assigned to this research subject for a study. (array: Identifier.yaml

status.title: candidate | eligible | follow-up | ineligible | not-registered | off-study | on-study | on-study-intervention | on-study-observation | pending-on-study | potential-candidate | screening | withdrawn
status.description: The current state of the subject. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/research-subject-status
status.binding_description: Indicates the progression of a study subject through a study.

term.description: Indicates the progression of a study subject through a study.

specimen.title: Specimen
specimen.description:
Sample for analysis.
A sample to be used for analysis.

accessionIdentifier.title: Identifier assigned by the lab
accessionIdentifier.description: The identifier assigned by the lab when accessioning specimen(s). This is not necessarily the same as the specimen identifier, depending on local lab procedures. Identifier

condition.title: State of the specimen
condition.description: A mode or state of being that describes the nature of the specimen. See http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v2-0493 (array: CodeableConcept.yaml
condition.binding_description: Codes describing the state of the specimen.

term.description: Codes describing the state of the specimen.

container.title: Direct container of specimen (tube/slide, etc.)
container.description: The container holding the specimen.  The recursive nature of containers; i.e. blood in tube in tray in rack is not addressed here. (array: SpecimenContainer.yaml

extension.title: Additional content defined by implementations
extension.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. (array: Extension.yaml

id.title: Logical id of this artifact
id.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

note.title: Comments
note.description: To communicate any details or issues about the specimen or during the specimen collection. (for example: broken vial, sent with patient, frozen). (array: Annotation.yaml

parent.title: Specimen from which this specimen originated
parent.description: Reference to the parent (source) specimen which is used when the specimen was either derived from or a component of another specimen. (array: Reference.yaml

processing.title: Processing and processing step details
processing.description: Details concerning processing and processing steps for the specimen. (array: SpecimenProcessing.yaml

receivedTime.title: The time when specimen was received for processing
receivedTime.description: Time when specimen was received for processing or testing.

request.title: Why the specimen was collected
request.description: Details concerning a service request that required a specimen to be collected. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. ServiceRequest (array: Reference.yaml

status.title: available | unavailable | unsatisfactory | entered-in-error
status.description: The availability of the specimen. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/specimen-status
status.binding_description: Codes providing the status/availability of a specimen.

term.description: Codes providing the status/availability of a specimen.

type.title: Kind of material that forms the specimen
type.description: The kind of material that forms the specimen. See http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v2-0487 CodeableConcept

term.description: The type of the specimen.

observation.title: Observation
observation.description:
Measurements and simple assertions.
Measurements and simple assertions made about a patient, device or other
subject.

basedOn.title: Fulfills plan, proposal or order
basedOn.description: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.  For example, a MedicationRequest may require a patient to have laboratory test performed before  it is dispensed. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. CarePlan DeviceRequest ServiceRequest NutritionOrder ImmunizationRecommendation (array: Reference.yaml

bodySite.title: Observed body part
bodySite.description: Indicates the site on the subject's body where the observation was made (i.e. the target site). See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/body-site CodeableConcept

term.description: SNOMED CT Body site concepts

category.title: Classification of  type of observation
category.description: A code that classifies the general type of observation being made. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/observation-category (array: CodeableConcept.yaml
category.binding_description: Codes for high level observation categories.

term.description: Codes for high level observation categories.

code.title: Type of observation (code / type)
code.description: Describes what was observed. Sometimes this is called the observation "name". See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/observation-codes CodeableConcept
code.binding_description: Codes identifying names of simple observations.

term.description: Codes identifying names of simple observations.

component.title: Component results
component.description: Some observations have multiple component observations.  These component observations are expressed as separate code value pairs that share the same attributes.  Examples include systolic and diastolic component observations for blood pressure measurement and multiple component observations for genetics observations. (array: ObservationComponent.yaml

dataAbsentReason.title: Why the result is missing
dataAbsentReason.description: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/data-absent-reason CodeableConcept
dataAbsentReason.binding_description: Codes specifying why the result (`Observation.value[x]`) is missing.

term.description: Codes specifying why the result (`Observation.value[x]`) is missing.

derivedFrom.title: Related measurements the observation is made from
derivedFrom.description: The target resource that represents a measurement from which this observation value is derived. For example, a calculated anion gap or a fetal measurement based on an ultrasound image. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. QuestionnaireResponse Media ImagingStudy MolecularSequence (array: Reference.yaml

effectiveDateTime.title: Clinically relevant time/time-period for observation
effectiveDateTime.description: The time or time-period the observed value is asserted as being true. For biological subjects - e.g. human patients - this is usually called the "physiologically relevant time". This is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection, but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself.

effectiveInstant.title: Clinically relevant time/time-period for observation
effectiveInstant.description: The time or time-period the observed value is asserted as being true. For biological subjects - e.g. human patients - this is usually called the "physiologically relevant time". This is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection, but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself.

effectivePeriod.title: Clinically relevant time/time-period for observation
effectivePeriod.description: The time or time-period the observed value is asserted as being true. For biological subjects - e.g. human patients - this is usually called the "physiologically relevant time". This is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection, but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself. Period

effectiveTiming.title: Clinically relevant time/time-period for observation
effectiveTiming.description: The time or time-period the observed value is asserted as being true. For biological subjects - e.g. human patients - this is usually called the "physiologically relevant time". This is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection, but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself. Timing

extension.title: Additional content defined by implementations
extension.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. (array: Extension.yaml

focus.title: What the observation is about, when it is not about the subject of record
focus.description: The actual focus of an observation when it is not the patient of record representing something or someone associated with the patient such as a spouse, parent, fetus, or donor. For example, fetus observations in a mother's record.  The focus of an observation could also be an existing condition,  an intervention, the subject's diet,  another observation of the subject,  or a body structure such as tumor or implanted device.   An example use case would be using the Observation resource to capture whether the mother is trained to change her child's tracheostomy tube. In this example, the child is the patient of record and the mother is the focus. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. Resource (array: Reference.yaml

hasMember.title: Related resource that belongs to the Observation group
hasMember.description: This observation is a group observation (e.g. a battery, a panel of tests, a set of vital sign measurements) that includes the target as a member of the group. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. MolecularSequence QuestionnaireResponse (array: Reference.yaml

id.title: Logical id of this artifact
id.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

identifier.title: Business Identifier for observation
identifier.description: A unique identifier assigned to this observation. (array: Identifier.yaml

interpretation.title: High, low, normal, etc.
interpretation.description: A categorical assessment of an observation value.  For example, high, low, normal. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/observation-interpretation (array: CodeableConcept.yaml

term.description: Codes identifying interpretations of observations.

issued.title: Date/Time this version was made available
issued.description: The date and time this version of the observation was made available to providers, typically after the results have been reviewed and verified.

method.title: How it was done
method.description: Indicates the mechanism used to perform the observation. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/observation-methods CodeableConcept

term.description: Methods for simple observations.

note.title: Comments about the observation
note.description: Comments about the observation or the results. (array: Annotation.yaml

partOf.title: Part of referenced event
partOf.description: A larger event of which this particular Observation is a component or step.  For example,  an observation as part of a procedure. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. Procedure Immunization ImagingStudy MedicationDispense MedicationStatement (array: Reference.yaml

performer.title: Who is responsible for the observation
performer.description: Who was responsible for asserting the observed value as "true". Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. Organization PractitionerRole CareTeam RelatedPerson (array: Reference.yaml

referenceRange.title: Provides guide for interpretation
referenceRange.description: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range.  Multiple reference ranges are interpreted as an "OR".   In other words, to represent two distinct target populations, two `referenceRange` elements would be used. (array: ObservationReferenceRange.yaml

status.title: registered | preliminary | final | amended +
status.description: The status of the result value. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/observation-status
status.binding_description: Codes providing the status of an observation.

term.description: Codes providing the status of an observation.

valueBoolean.title: Actual result
valueBoolean.description: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

valueCodeableConcept.title: Actual result
valueCodeableConcept.description: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value. CodeableConcept

valueDateTime.title: Actual result
valueDateTime.description: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

valueInteger.title: Actual result
valueInteger.description: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

valuePeriod.title: Actual result
valuePeriod.description: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value. Period

valueQuantity.title: Actual result
valueQuantity.description: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value. Quantity

valueRange.title: Actual result
valueRange.description: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value. Range

valueRatio.title: Actual result
valueRatio.description: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value. Ratio

valueSampledData.title: Actual result
valueSampledData.description: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value. SampledData

valueString.title: Actual result
valueString.description: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

valueTime.title: Actual result
valueTime.description: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

diagnostic_report.title: DiagnosticReport
diagnostic_report.description:
A Diagnostic report - a combination of request information, atomic results,
images, interpretation, as well as formatted reports.
The findings and interpretation of diagnostic  tests performed on patients,
groups of patients, devices, and locations, and/or specimens derived from
these. The report includes clinical context such as requesting and provider
information, and some mix of atomic results, images, textual and coded
interpretations, and formatted representation of diagnostic reports.

basedOn.title: What was requested
basedOn.description: Details concerning a service requested. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. CarePlan ServiceRequest NutritionOrder ImmunizationRecommendation MedicationRequest (array: Reference.yaml

category.title: Service category
category.description: A code that classifies the clinical discipline, department or diagnostic service that created the report (e.g. cardiology, biochemistry, hematology, MRI). This is used for searching, sorting and display purposes. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/diagnostic-service-sections (array: CodeableConcept.yaml

term.description: HL7 V2 table 0074

code.title: Name/Code for this diagnostic report
code.description: A code or name that describes this diagnostic report. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/report-codes CodeableConcept

term.description: LOINC Codes for Diagnostic Reports

conclusion.title: Clinical conclusion (interpretation) of test results
conclusion.description: Concise and clinically contextualized summary conclusion (interpretation/impression) of the diagnostic report.

conclusionCode.title: Codes for the clinical conclusion of test results
conclusionCode.description: One or more codes that represent the summary conclusion (interpretation/impression) of the diagnostic report. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/clinical-findings (array: CodeableConcept.yaml

term.description: SNOMED CT Clinical Findings

effectiveDateTime.title: Clinically relevant time/time-period for report
effectiveDateTime.description: The time or time-period the observed values are related to. When the subject of the report is a patient, this is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection(s), but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself.

effectivePeriod.title: Clinically relevant time/time-period for report
effectivePeriod.description: The time or time-period the observed values are related to. When the subject of the report is a patient, this is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection(s), but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself. Period

extension.title: Additional content defined by implementations
extension.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. (array: Extension.yaml

id.title: Logical id of this artifact
id.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

identifier.title: Business identifier for report
identifier.description: Identifiers assigned to this report by the performer or other systems. (array: Identifier.yaml

imagingStudy.title: Reference to full details of imaging associated with the diagnostic report
imagingStudy.description: One or more links to full details of any imaging performed during the diagnostic investigation. Typically, this is imaging performed by DICOM enabled modalities, but this is not required. A fully enabled PACS viewer can use this information to provide views of the source images. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. ImagingStudy (array: Reference.yaml

issued.title: DateTime this version was made
issued.description: The date and time that this version of the report was made available to providers, typically after the report was reviewed and verified.

media.title: Key images associated with this report
media.description: A list of key images associated with this report. The images are generally created during the diagnostic process, and may be directly of the patient, or of treated specimens (i.e. slides of interest). (array: DiagnosticReportMedia.yaml

performer.title: Responsible Diagnostic Service
performer.description: The diagnostic service that is responsible for issuing the report. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. Organization CareTeam Practitioner PractitionerRole (array: Reference.yaml

presentedForm.title: Entire report as issued
presentedForm.description: Rich text representation of the entire result as issued by the diagnostic service. Multiple formats are allowed but they SHALL be semantically equivalent. (array: Attachment.yaml

result.title: Observations
result.description: [Observations](observation.html)  that are part of this diagnostic report. (array: Reference.yaml

resultsInterpreter.title: Primary result interpreter
resultsInterpreter.description: The practitioner or organization that is responsible for the report's conclusions and interpretations. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. Organization CareTeam Practitioner PractitionerRole (array: Reference.yaml

specimen.title: Specimens this report is based on
specimen.description: Details about the specimens on which this diagnostic report is based. (array: Reference.yaml

status.title: registered | partial | preliminary | final +
status.description: The status of the diagnostic report. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/diagnostic-report-status
status.binding_description: The status of the diagnostic report.

term.description: The status of the diagnostic report.

condition.title: Condition
condition.description:
Detailed information about conditions, problems or diagnoses.
A clinical condition, problem, diagnosis, or other event, situation, issue,
or clinical concept that has risen to a level of concern.

abatementAge.title: When in resolution/remission
abatementAge.description: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate. Age

abatementDateTime.title: When in resolution/remission
abatementDateTime.description: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

abatementPeriod.title: When in resolution/remission
abatementPeriod.description: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate. Period

abatementRange.title: When in resolution/remission
abatementRange.description: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate. Range

abatementString.title: When in resolution/remission
abatementString.description: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

bodySite.title: Anatomical location, if relevant
bodySite.description: The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/body-site (array: CodeableConcept.yaml

term.description: SNOMED CT Body site concepts

category.title: problem-list-item | encounter-diagnosis
category.description: A category assigned to the condition. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/condition-category (array: CodeableConcept.yaml
category.binding_description: A category assigned to the condition.

term.description: A category assigned to the condition.

clinicalStatus.title: active | recurrence | relapse | inactive | remission | resolved
clinicalStatus.description: The clinical status of the condition. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/condition-clinical CodeableConcept
clinicalStatus.binding_description: The clinical status of the condition or diagnosis.

term.description: The clinical status of the condition or diagnosis.

code.title: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis
code.binding_description: Identification of the condition or diagnosis.

term.description: Identification of the condition or diagnosis.

evidence.title: Supporting evidence
evidence.description: Supporting evidence / manifestations that are the basis of the Condition's verification status, such as evidence that confirmed or refuted the condition. (array: ConditionEvidence.yaml

extension.title: Additional content defined by implementations
extension.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. (array: Extension.yaml

id.title: Logical id of this artifact
id.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

identifier.title: External Ids for this condition
identifier.description: Business identifiers assigned to this condition by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server. (array: Identifier.yaml

note.title: Additional information about the Condition
note.description: Additional information about the Condition. This is a general notes/comments entry  for description of the Condition, its diagnosis and prognosis. (array: Annotation.yaml

onsetAge.title: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age
onsetAge.description: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician. Age

onsetDateTime.title: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age
onsetDateTime.description: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

onsetPeriod.title: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age
onsetPeriod.description: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician. Period

onsetRange.title: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age
onsetRange.description: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician. Range

onsetString.title: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age
onsetString.description: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

recordedDate.title: Date record was first recorded
recordedDate.description: The recordedDate represents when this particular Condition record was created in the system, which is often a system-generated date.

severity.title: Subjective severity of condition
severity.description: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/condition-severity CodeableConcept
severity.binding_description: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

term.description: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

stage.title: Stage/grade, usually assessed formally
stage.description: Clinical stage or grade of a condition. May include formal severity assessments. (array: ConditionStage.yaml

verificationStatus.title: unconfirmed | provisional | differential | confirmed | refuted | entered-in-error
verificationStatus.description: The verification status to support the clinical status of the condition. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/condition-ver-status CodeableConcept
verificationStatus.binding_description: The verification status to support or decline the clinical status of the condition or diagnosis.

term.description: The verification status to support or decline the clinical status of the condition or diagnosis.

substance.title: Substance
substance.description: A homogeneous material with a definite composition.

category.title: What class/type of substance this is
category.description: A code that classifies the general type of substance.  This is used  for searching, sorting and display purposes. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/substance-category (array: CodeableConcept.yaml

term.description: Category or classification of substance.

code.title: What substance this is
code.description: A code (or set of codes) that identify this substance. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/substance-code CodeableConcept

term.description: Substance codes.

description.title: Textual description of the substance, comments
description.description: A description of the substance - its appearance, handling requirements, and other usage notes.
