extension.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. (array: Extension.yaml

id.title: Logical id of this artifact
id.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

identifier.title: Unique identifier
identifier.description: Unique identifier for the substance. (array: Identifier.yaml

ingredient.title: Composition information about the substance
ingredient.description: A substance can be composed of other substances. (array: SubstanceIngredient.yaml

instance.title: If this describes a specific package/container of the substance
instance.description: Substance may be used to describe a kind of substance, or a specific package/container of the substance: an instance. (array: SubstanceInstance.yaml

status.title: active | inactive | entered-in-error
status.description: A code to indicate if the substance is actively used. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/substance-status
status.binding_description: A code to indicate if the substance is actively used.

term.description: A code to indicate if the substance is actively used.

medication.title: Medication
medication.description:
Definition of a Medication.
This resource is primarily used for the identification and definition of a
medication for the purposes of prescribing, dispensing, and administering a
medication as well as for making statements about medication use.

code.title: Codes that identify this medication
code.description: A code (or set of codes) that specify this medication, or a textual description if no code is available. Usage note: This could be a standard medication code such as a code from RxNorm, SNOMED CT, IDMP etc. It could also be a national or local formulary code, optionally with translations to other code systems. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/medication-codes CodeableConcept
code.binding_description: A coded concept that defines the type of a medication.

term.description: A coded concept that defines the type of a medication.

extension.title: Additional content defined by implementations
extension.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. (array: Extension.yaml

form.title: powder | tablets | capsule +
form.description: Describes the form of the item.  Powder; tablets; capsule. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/medication-form-codes CodeableConcept
form.binding_description: A coded concept defining the form of a medication.

term.description: A coded concept defining the form of a medication.

id.title: Logical id of this artifact
id.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

ingredient.title: Active or inactive ingredient
ingredient.description: Identifies a particular constituent of interest in the product. (array: MedicationIngredient.yaml

status.title: active | inactive | entered-in-error
status.description: A code to indicate if the medication is in active use. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/medication-status
status.binding_description: A coded concept defining if the medication is in active use.

term.description: A coded concept defining if the medication is in active use.

medication_administration.title: MedicationAdministration
medication_administration.description:
Administration of medication to a patient.
Describes the event of a patient consuming or otherwise being administered
a medication.  This may be as simple as swallowing a tablet or it may be a
long running infusion.  Related resources tie this event to the authorizing
prescription, and the specific encounter between patient and health care
practitioner.

category.title: Type of medication usage
category.description: Indicates where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/medication-admin-category CodeableConcept
category.binding_description: A coded concept describing where the medication administered is expected to occur.

term.description: A coded concept describing where the medication administered is expected to occur.

device.title: Device used to administer
device.description: The device used in administering the medication to the patient.  For example, a particular infusion pump. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. Device (array: Reference.yaml

effectiveDateTime.title: Start and end time of administration
effectiveDateTime.description: A specific date/time or interval of time during which the administration took place (or did not take place, when the 'notGiven' attribute is true). For many administrations, such as swallowing a tablet the use of dateTime is more appropriate.

effectivePeriod.title: Start and end time of administration
effectivePeriod.description: A specific date/time or interval of time during which the administration took place (or did not take place, when the 'notGiven' attribute is true). For many administrations, such as swallowing a tablet the use of dateTime is more appropriate. Period

eventHistory.title: A list of events of interest in the lifecycle
eventHistory.description: A summary of the events of interest that have occurred, such as when the administration was verified. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. Provenance (array: Reference.yaml

extension.title: Additional content defined by implementations
extension.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. (array: Extension.yaml

id.title: Logical id of this artifact
id.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

identifier.title: External identifier
identifier.description: Identifiers associated with this Medication Administration that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate. They are business identifiers assigned to this resource by the performer or other systems and remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server. (array: Identifier.yaml

instantiates.title: Instantiates protocol or definition
instantiates.description: A protocol, guideline, orderset, or other definition that was adhered to in whole or in part by this event. (array: string

medicationCodeableConcept.title: What was administered
medicationCodeableConcept.description: Identifies the medication that was administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/medication-codes CodeableConcept
medicationCodeableConcept.binding_description: Codes identifying substance or product that can be administered.

term.description: Codes identifying substance or product that can be administered.

medicationReference.title: What was administered
medicationReference.description: Identifies the medication that was administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/medication-codes Reference

note.title: Information about the administration
note.description: Extra information about the medication administration that is not conveyed by the other attributes. (array: Annotation.yaml

partOf.title: Part of referenced event
partOf.description: A larger event of which this particular event is a component or step. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. Procedure (array: Reference.yaml

performer.title: Who performed the medication administration and what they did
performer.description: Indicates who or what performed the medication administration and how they were involved. (array: MedicationAdministrationPerformer.yaml

reasonCode.title: Reason administration performed
reasonCode.description: A code indicating why the medication was given. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/reason-medication-given-codes (array: CodeableConcept.yaml
reasonCode.binding_description: A set of codes indicating the reason why the MedicationAdministration was made.

term.description: A set of codes indicating the reason why the MedicationAdministration was made.

reasonReference.title: Condition or observation that supports why the medication was administered

request.title: Request administration performed against
request.description: The original request, instruction or authority to perform the administration. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. MedicationRequest Reference

status.title: in-progress | not-done | on-hold | completed | entered-in-error | stopped | unknown
status.description: Will generally be set to show that the administration has been completed.  For some long running administrations such as infusions, it is possible for an administration to be started but not completed or it may be paused while some other process is under way. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/medication-admin-status
status.binding_description: A set of codes indicating the current status of a MedicationAdministration.

term.description: A set of codes indicating the current status of a MedicationAdministration.

statusReason.title: Reason administration not performed
statusReason.description: A code indicating why the administration was not performed. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/reason-medication-not-given-codes (array: CodeableConcept.yaml
statusReason.binding_description: A set of codes indicating the reason why the MedicationAdministration is negated.

term.description: A set of codes indicating the reason why the MedicationAdministration is negated.

subject.title: Who received medication
subject.description: The person or animal or group receiving the medication. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. Group Reference

supportingInformation.title: Additional information to support administration
supportingInformation.description: Additional information (for example, patient height and weight) that supports the administration of the medication. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. Resource (array: Reference.yaml

document_reference.title: DocumentReference
document_reference.description:
A reference to a document.
A reference to a document of any kind for any purpose. Provides metadata
about the document so that the document can be discovered and managed. The
scope of a document is any seralized object with a mime-type, so includes
formal patient centric documents (CDA), cliical notes, scanned paper, and
non-patient specific documents like policy text.

author.title: Who and/or what authored the document
author.description: Identifies who is responsible for adding the information to the document. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. Organization PractitionerRole RelatedPerson Device (array: Reference.yaml

category.title: Categorization of document
category.description: A categorization for the type of document referenced - helps for indexing and searching. This may be implied by or derived from the code specified in the DocumentReference.type. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/doc-classcodes (array: CodeableConcept.yaml
category.binding_description: High-level kind of a clinical document at a macro level.

term.description: High-level kind of a clinical document at a macro level.

content.title: Document referenced
content.description: The document and format referenced. There may be multiple content element repetitions, each with a different format. (array: DocumentReferenceContent.yaml

date.title: When this document reference was created
date.description: When the document reference was created.

description.title: Human-readable description
description.description: Human-readable description of the source document.

docStatus.title: preliminary | final | amended | entered-in-error
docStatus.description: The status of the underlying document. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/composition-status

term.description: Status of the underlying document.

extension.title: Additional content defined by implementations
extension.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. (array: Extension.yaml

id.title: Logical id of this artifact
id.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

identifier.title: Other identifiers for the document
identifier.description: Other identifiers associated with the document, including version independent identifiers. (array: Identifier.yaml

masterIdentifier.title: Master Version Specific Identifier
masterIdentifier.description: Document identifier as assigned by the source of the document. This identifier is specific to this version of the document. This unique identifier may be used elsewhere to identify this version of the document. Identifier

relatesTo.title: Relationships to other documents
relatesTo.description: Relationships that this document has with other document references that already exist. (array: DocumentReferenceRelatesTo.yaml

securityLabel.title: Document security-tags
securityLabel.description: A set of Security-Tag codes specifying the level of privacy/security of the Document. Note that DocumentReference.meta.security contains the security labels of the "reference" to the document, while DocumentReference.securityLabel contains a snapshot of the security labels on the document the reference refers to. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/security-labels (array: CodeableConcept.yaml
securityLabel.binding_description: Security Labels from the Healthcare Privacy and Security Classification System.

term.description: Security Labels from the Healthcare Privacy and Security Classification System.

status.title: current | superseded | entered-in-error
status.description: The status of this document reference. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/document-reference-status
status.binding_description: The status of the document reference.

term.description: The status of the document reference.

type.title: Kind of document (LOINC if possible)
type.description: Specifies the particular kind of document referenced  (e.g. History and Physical, Discharge Summary, Progress Note). This usually equates to the purpose of making the document referenced. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/doc-typecodes CodeableConcept

term.description: Precise type of clinical document.

authoredOn.title: Task Creation Date
authoredOn.description: The date and time this task was created.

basedOn.title: Request fulfilled by this task
basedOn.description: BasedOn refers to a higher-level authorization that triggered the creation of the task.  It references a "request" resource such as a ServiceRequest, MedicationRequest, ServiceRequest, CarePlan, etc. which is distinct from the "request" resource the task is seeking to fulfill.  This latter resource is referenced by FocusOn.  For example, based on a ServiceRequest (= BasedOn), a task is created to fulfill a procedureRequest ( = FocusOn ) to collect a specimen from a patient. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. Resource (array: Reference.yaml

businessStatus.title: E.g. "Specimen collected", "IV prepped"
businessStatus.description: Contains business-specific nuances of the business state. CodeableConcept
businessStatus.binding_description: The domain-specific business-contextual sub-state of the task.  For example: "Blood drawn", "IV inserted", "Awaiting physician signature", etc.

code.title: Task Type
code.description: A name or code (or both) briefly describing what the task involves. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/task-code CodeableConcept
code.binding_description: Codes to identify what the task involves.  These will typically be specific to a particular workflow.

term.description: Codes to identify what the task involves.  These will typically be specific to a particular workflow.

description.title: Human-readable explanation of task
description.description: A free-text description of what is to be performed.

extension.title: Additional content defined by implementations
extension.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. (array: Extension.yaml

groupIdentifier.title: Requisition or grouper id
groupIdentifier.description: An identifier that links together multiple tasks and other requests that were created in the same context. Identifier

id.title: Logical id of this artifact
id.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

identifier.title: Task Instance Identifier
identifier.description: The business identifier for this task. (array: Identifier.yaml

input.title: Information used to perform task
input.description: Additional information that may be needed in the execution of the task. (array: TaskInput.yaml

instantiatesCanonical.title: Formal definition of task
instantiatesCanonical.description: The URL pointing to a *FHIR*-defined protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Task. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. ActivityDefinition

instantiatesUri.title: Formal definition of task
instantiatesUri.description: The URL pointing to an *externally* maintained  protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Task.

insurance.title: Associated insurance coverage
insurance.description: Insurance plans, coverage extensions, pre-authorizations and/or pre-determinations that may be relevant to the Task. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. Coverage ClaimResponse (array: Reference.yaml

intent.title: unknown | proposal | plan | order | original-order | reflex-order | filler-order | instance-order | option
intent.description: Indicates the "level" of actionability associated with the Task, i.e. i+R[9]Cs this a proposed task, a planned task, an actionable task, etc. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/task-intent
intent.binding_description: Distinguishes whether the task is a proposal, plan or full order.

term.description: Distinguishes whether the task is a proposal, plan or full order.

lastModified.title: Task Last Modified Date
lastModified.description: The date and time of last modification to this task.

note.title: Comments made about the task
note.description: Free-text information captured about the task as it progresses. (array: Annotation.yaml

output.title: Information produced as part of task
output.description: Outputs produced by the Task. (array: TaskOutput.yaml

partOf.title: Composite task
partOf.description: Task that this particular task is part of. (array: Reference.yaml

performerType.title: Requested performer
performerType.description: The kind of participant that should perform the task. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/performer-role (array: CodeableConcept.yaml
performerType.binding_description: The type(s) of task performers allowed.

term.description: The type(s) of task performers allowed.

priority.title: routine | urgent | asap | stat
priority.description: Indicates how quickly the Task should be addressed with respect to other requests. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/request-priority
priority.binding_description: The priority of a task (may affect service level applied to the task).

term.description: The priority of a task (may affect service level applied to the task).

reasonCode.title: Why task is needed
reasonCode.description: A description or code indicating why this task needs to be performed. CodeableConcept
reasonCode.binding_description: Indicates why the task is needed.  E.g. Suspended because patient admitted to hospital.

relevantHistory.title: Key events in history of the Task
relevantHistory.description: Links to Provenance records for past versions of this Task that identify key state transitions or updates that are likely to be relevant to a user looking at the current version of the task. Note: following not in scope, see config.dependency_order. (array: Reference.yaml

status.title: draft | requested | received | accepted | +
status.description: The current status of the task. See http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/task-status
status.binding_description: The current status of the task.

term.description: The current status of the task.

statusReason.title: Reason for current status
statusReason.description: An explanation as to why this task is held, failed, was refused, etc. CodeableConcept
statusReason.binding_description: Codes to identify the reason for current status.  These will typically be specific to a particular workflow.

_program.yaml.title: Program
_program.yaml.description: A broad framework of goals to be achieved. (NCIt C52647)

dbgap_accession_number.description: The dbgap accession number provided for the program.

_project.yaml.title: Project
_project.yaml.description: Any specifically defined piece of work that is undertaken or attempted to meet a single requirement. (NCIt C47885)

name.description: Display name/brief description for the project.

investigator_name.description: Name of the principal investigator for the project.

investigator_affiliation.description: The investigator's affiliation with respect to a research institution.

date_collected.description: The date or date range in which the project data was collected.

availability_type.description: Is the project open or restricted?

availability_mechanism.description: Mechanism by which the project will be made avilable.

support_source.description: The name of source providing support/grant resources.

support_id.description: The ID of the source providing support/grant resources.

programs.description: Indicates that the project is logically part of the indicated project.

state.description:
The possible states a project can be in.  All but `open` are
equivalent to some type of locked state.

released.description:
To release a project is to tell the GDC to include all submitted
entities in the next GDC index.

releasable.description: A project can only be released by the user when `releasable` is true.

intended_release_date.description: Tracks a Project's intended release date.

dbgap_accession_number.description: The dbgap accession number provided for the project.

_core_metadata_collection.yaml.title: Core Metadata Collection
_core_metadata_collection.yaml.description: A collection of data files in a project.  DEPRECATED - included for portal compatibility

contributor.description: An entity responsible for making contributions to the resource. Examples of a Contributor include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Contributor should be used to indicate the entity.

coverage.description: The spatial or temporal topic of the resource, the spatial applicability of the resource, or the jurisdiction under which the resource is relevant. Spatial topic and spatial applicability may be a named place or a location specified by its geographic coordinates. Temporal topic may be a named period, date, or date range. A jurisdiction may be a named administrative entity or a geographic place to which the resource applies. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Thesaurus of Geographic Names [TGN] (http-//www.getty.edu/research/tools/vocabulary/tgn/index.html). Where appropriate, named places or time periods can be used in preference to numeric identifiers such as sets of coordinates or date ranges.

creator.description: An entity primarily responsible for making the resource. Examples of a Creator include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Creator should be used to indicate the entity.

data_type.description: The nature or genre of the resource. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the DCMI Type Vocabulary [DCMITYPE]. To describe the file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource, use the Format element.

date.description: The date the collection of data was created.

description.description: An account of the resource. Description may include but is not limited to- an abstract, a table of contents, a graphical representation, or a free-text account of the resource.

format.description: The file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource. Examples of dimensions include size and duration. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the list of Internet Media Types [MIME] (http-//www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/).

language.description: A language of the resource. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as RFC 4646 (http-//www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc4646.txt).

publisher.description: An entity responsible for making the resource available. Examples of a Publisher include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Publisher should be used to indicate the entity.

relation.description: A related resource. Recommended best practice is to identify the related resource by means of a string conforming to a formal identification system.

rights.description: Information about rights held in and over the resource. Typically, rights information includes a statement about various property rights associated with the resource, including intellectual property rights.

source.description: A related resource from which the described resource is derived. The described resource may be derived from the related resource in whole or in part. Recommended best practice is to identify the related resource by means of a string conforming to a formal identification system.

subject.description: The topic of the resource. Typically, the subject will be represented using keywords, key phrases, or classification codes. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

title.description: A name given to the resource. Typically, a Title will be a name by which the resource is formally known.

projects.description: The project code for the record in the project node that this core_metadata_collection belongs to, i.e., a link to the parent node.
